examples: It was with a hilted knife maybe? I’m told, in the big world it’s bloody knives they use.

entries.meaning: (in compounds) Having a hilt of a specified type.
examples: The grim-visaged pirate captain, in his laced cap, rich jacket, and short white knee-trunks, with heavy gold chains round his neck, and jewel-hilted dagger in belt, was a striking and characteristic feature of New York life at the close of the seventeenth century.

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of hilt
